result.execSummary:
The defendant Samatra Proctor Collins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Flee Or Elude An Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Possession Of A Firearm By A Felon

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other case, with credit for 183 days served with good time.
- Provide a DNA sample.

Defendant to pay all non-waivable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharges by 8-29-2023. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment. Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Samatra Proctor Collins

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Samatra Proctor Collins in court, in custody.  Attorney Ashley Fard in court for Samatra Proctor Collins.  Attorney Gerald Henry Alder in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Parties prepared to proceed with sentencing. Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.

Court sentenced the defendant to serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent with any other case, with credit for 183 days served with good time. 

Court revokes driver's license for 6 months.
- Provide a DNA sample. 

Defendant to pay all non-waivable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharges by 8-29-2023. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment. Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.

*Court advised defendant of appellant rights. 
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Defendant Samatra Proctor Collins in court, in custody.  Attorney Ashley Fard in court for Samatra Proctor Collins.  Attorney Gerald Henry Alder in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Parties have reached a resolution. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNT 2.  

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Count 1 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen deportation is possible. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived their rights.  Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Defendant is advised is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms.  
Defendant is advised unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored.  

Case passed to afternoon for sentencing.
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea and Elements.

Attorney Ashley Fard in court, defendant Samatra Proctor Collins not in court, in custody.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for jury trial. State filed motion to adjourn. Defense has no objection. Case adjourned, Branch 2.  Jury trial scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Notice of Motion to Adjourn Jury Trial, filed by the State

Defendant Samatra Proctor Collins in court with attorney Ashley Fard.  Defendant Samatra Proctor Collins in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense withdraws request for bail hearing. Case remains in trial posture. Case adjourned for jury trial, 07-25-2022 at 9:00 am, Branch 2.
CORRECTION TO 4/29/2022 STATUS CONFERENCE:  JURY TRIAL SCHEDULED FOR 07-25-2022 AT 9:00 AM

Attorney Ashley Fard in court, defendant Samatra Proctor Collins not in court, in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a final pretrial and jury trial date. Case adjourned, Branch 2.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. - Exp: 7/5/22

Defendant Samatra Proctor Collins in court with attorney Ashley Fard.  Defendant Samatra Proctor Collins in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appeared by video means due to Covid-19 protocol.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #10CF3460. Sworn for the State: City of MKE Police Officer Stephen Arnold.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 2.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Ashley Fard in court by video, defendant Samatra Proctor Collins not in court, in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Attorney Fard is newly appointed and needs more time to meet with her client. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Pretrial Order, signed and filed.

DAR UNAVAILABLE DUE TO TECHNICAL DIFFICULTIES.  CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD. Defendant Samatra Proctor Collins in court with attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons.  Defendant Samatra Proctor Collins in custody.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Samatra Proctor Collins appeared by video means with Attorney.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
